children.text: ”), each a Party and collectively the Parties. Provider desires to perform, and the Company desires to have Provider perform, consulting services as an independent contractor to the Company, on the terms and conditions set forth in this Agreement.

”).  Provider acknowledges that time is of the essence with respect to Provider’s obligations to fulfill the Services hereunder and that prompt and timely performance of all such Services is strictly required.

.  Subject to the terms and conditions of this Agreement, for the performance of the Services, the Company will pay Provider the compensation as set forth in the Project Description, on the terms and in the manner set forth in the Project Description.  Such compensation shall be the sole and exclusive compensation for all Services.

The Provider shall be responsible for maintaining, at the Provider’s own expense, a place of work, any equipment and supplies necessary for the performance of the Services. Use if the user chose “Yes”: The Company will promptly reimburse Provider for all reasonable out-of-pocket expenses incurred by Provider in the performance of the Services to the Company, provided that Provider properly accounts for them in accordance with the Company’s policies and, provided further, that Provider obtains the prior written consent of the Chief Executive Officer or the Chief Operating Officer of the Company for any such expenses.] if the user chose “no”:
The Service Provider will not be entitled to any other consideration for rendering the Services hereunder.

. This Agreement is effective beginning on the Effective Date and continuing either for the period stated in the Project Description or if no period is stated, until terminated by either party as permitted hereunder
Either party may terminate this Agreement immediately in the event of a material breach by the other party of this Agreement if such breach continues uncured for a period of

Agreement immediately in the event of a material breach by the other party of this Agreement if such breach continues uncured for a period of [ten (10)] days after written notice.  The Company may terminate this Agreement at any time for any reason upon written notice to Provider.  Provider may terminate this Agreement at any time for any reason by providing at least [thirty (30)] days’ prior written notice to the Company

This Agreement is effective beginning on the Effective Date and continuing either for the period stated in the Project Description or if no period is stated, until terminated by either party as permitted hereunder.

. The Company’s election to terminate this Agreement in accordance with its terms shall not be deemed an election of remedies, and all other remedies provided by this Agreement or available at law or in equity shall survive any termination. If the Company exercises its right to terminate this Agreement, any obligation it may otherwise have under this Agreement shall cease immediately, except that the Company shall be obligated to compensate the Provider for Services properly performed up to the effective date of termination.  If Provider exercises its right to terminate this Agreement, any obligation it may otherwise have under this Agreement shall cease immediately.  Upon the expiration or termination of this Agreement for any reason, the Provider will promptly return to the Company all Company property at Provider’s expense and in accordance with the Company’s instructions.  Notwithstanding any termination or expiration of this Agreement, all provisions which by their terms or sense are intended to survive will survive, including without limitation all provisions of the Confidentiality and Inventions Assignment Agreement.

.  Provider is an independent contractor and is not an agent or employee of, and has no authority to bind, the Company by contract or otherwise.  Provider will perform the Services under the general direction of the Company, but Provider will determine, in Provider’s sole discretion, the manner and means by which the Services are accomplished, and the Company has no right or authority to control the manner or means by which the Services are accomplished, subject to the requirement that Provider shall at all times comply with applicable law and the Company’s code of ethics.

.  Provider will report as self-employment income all compensation received by Provider pursuant to this Agreement.  Provider will indemnify the Company and hold it harmless from and against all claims, damages, losses and expenses, including reasonable fees and expenses of attorneys and other professionals, relating to any obligation imposed by law on the Company to pay any withholding taxes, social security, unemployment or disability insurance, or similar items in connection with compensation received by Provider pursuant to this Agreement.  Provider shall not receive any insurance or other benefits, including workers’ compensation, unemployment or health benefits that are offered to employees of Company.  Provider agrees to maintain its own insurance policies to cover Provider’s work-related injuries (workers’ compensation) as well as general and professional liability insurance.
. Nothing contained in this Agreement shall be construed as giving Provider any right to employment, current or future, with the Company.

.  Provider shall not make any written use of or reference to the Company’s name for any marketing, public relations, advertising, display or other business purpose or make any use of the Company’s facilities for any activity unrelated to the express business purposes and interests of the Company under this Agreement without the prior written consent of the Company, which consent may be granted or withheld in the Company’s sole discretion.

.  As an independent contractor to the Company, Provider will have access to certain Company confidential information and Provider may, during the course of its engagement, develop certain information, reports, work product or analyses which will be property of the Company.  As a condition to Provider’s engagement as an independent contractor, Provider must sign the Company’s Confidentiality & Inventions Assignment Agreement in the form attached as
concurrent with retention as an independent contractor.
Provider acknowledges and recognizes the highly competitive nature of the business of the Company and its subsidiaries and affiliates and accordingly agrees as follows:

. Provider represents, warrants and agrees that at no time, either during the Term or after the termination or expiration of this Agreement, will Provider disparage the Company or any of its products or services.
. During the term of Provider’s engagement [and for X months following the date Provider ceases to be engaged by the Company] (the “

”), Provider will not directly or indirectly, (x) engage in any business for Provider’s own account that would render Provider a Direct Competitor (as defined below), (y) enter the employ of, render any services to, acquire a financial interest in, or otherwise become actively involved with, a Direct Competitor, or (z) interfere with business relationships (whether formed before or after the date of this Agreement) between the Company and customers or suppliers of, or Providers to, the Company that were engaged in, or were immediate prospects for engaging in, business with the Company before Provider’s engagement with the Company was terminated.  For purposes of this Section 6, the Company shall be construed to include the Company and its subsidiaries and affiliates.  For purposes of this Section 6, “

” shall mean [INSERT A REASONABLY TAILORED DESCRIPTION OF THE COMPANY’S BUSINESS], and any other business activity the Company engages in during the term of Provider’s engagement with the Company.  For purposes of this Section 6, “

” shall mean any person, entity or subsidiary of an entity that is engaged in any business that competes with the Business.  For the avoidance of doubt, where an entity has multiple subsidiaries, only those that are engaged in a business that competes with the Business shall be Direct Competitors hereunder [[soft non compete] Provider agrees that, during the Term, they will promptly notify the Company in writing of any Direct Competitor of the Company to which they are also performing services.  It is understood that in such event, the Company will review Provider’s activities and determine whether they shall remain as Provider to the Company].
Notwithstanding anything to the contrary in this Agreement, Provider acknowledges that Provider may
directly or indirectly own, solely as an investment,
the securities of any competing entity listed on a national securities exchange or traded in the over-the-counter market, but only if Provider

(i) is not a controlling person of, or a member of a group which controls, such entity and (ii) does not, directly or indirectly, own three percent (3%) or more of any class of securities of such entity.

. During the [Term] [and for X months after], Provider will not, directly or indirectly, solicit or encourage to cease to work with the Company, or directly or indirectly hire, any person who is an employee of or Provider then under contract with the Company or who was an employee of or Provider then under contract with the Company within the [six (6)]-month period preceding Provider’s termination of engagement without the Company’s written consent.

. During the [Term] [and for X months after], Provider will not, directly or indirectly, solicit or encourage to cease to work with the Company, any person or entity that is a client, customer, supplier, or contractor of the Company or who was a client, customer, supplier, or contractor of the Company within the [six (6)-month period] preceding Provider’s termination of engagement without the Company’s written consent.

. It is expressly understood and agreed that although Provider and the Company consider the restrictions contained in this Section 6 to be reasonable, if a judicial determination is made by a court of competent jurisdiction that the time or territory or any other restriction contained in this Agreement is an unenforceable restriction against Provider, the provisions of this Agreement shall not be rendered void but shall be deemed amended to apply as to such maximum time and territory and to such maximum extent as such court may judicially determine or indicate to be enforceable.  Alternatively, if any court of competent jurisdiction finds that any restriction contained in this Agreement is unenforceable, and such restriction cannot be amended so as to make it enforceable, such finding shall not affect the enforceability of any of the other restrictions contained herein.  The provisions of this Section 6 shall survive any termination or expiration of this Agreement.

. Provider has no pre-existing obligations or commitments (and will not assume or otherwise undertake any obligations or commitments) that would hinder Provider’s performance of its obligations under this Agreement.

.  Each Party shall indemnify the other Party and hold it harmless from and against all claims, damages, losses and expenses, including reasonable fees and expenses of attorneys and other professionals, relating to or arising out of the indemnifying Party’s breach of any representation, warranty or obligation under this Agreement.

.  This Agreement, together with its exhibits, constitutes the complete and exclusive understanding and agreement of the parties with respect to the subject matter hereof and supersedes all prior understandings and agreements, whether written or oral, with respect to the subject matter hereof.  In the event of a conflict, the terms and conditions of the Project Description will take precedence over the terms and conditions of this Agreement.  Any waiver, modification or amendment of any provision of this Agreement will be effective only if in writing and signed by the parties hereto. The waiver of any breach of any provision of this Agreement shall not constitute a waiver of any subsequent breach of the same other provisions hereof.

.  [Provider shall have no right to (i) assign this Agreement, in whole or in part, by operation of law or otherwise]; [or (ii) subcontract or otherwise delegate the performance of the Services without the Company’s prior written consent.]  Any attempted [assignment] [or delegation] without such consent will be void.

Provider may retain subcontractors to aid Provider in the performance of the Services should Provider deem it necessary. Provider represents and warrants that prior to assigning any individual or subcontractor to the provision of Services for Company Provider shall have a binding written agreement in place with such individual or subcontractor that contains confidentiality provisions no less restrictive than those of this Agreement and provisions legally sufficient to allow Provider to provide Company the rights described herein. Provider shall ensure that all individuals and subcontractors who provide Services hereunder shall have sufficient skill and experience in relevant areas and adequate training to permit them to timely perform their assigned tasks in a professional and workmanlike manner.  Provider shall be responsible for the performance of its subcontractors to the same extent as Provider is responsible for its own performance.]
This Agreement shall be binding upon, and inure to the benefit of, the successors, executors, heirs, representatives and permitted assigns of the parties hereto.

.  This Agreement will be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of the State of New York, excluding its conflict of laws principles.  Any legal action or proceeding arising under this Agreement will be brought exclusively in the federal or state courts located in New York, New York and the parties hereby consent to the exclusive personal jurisdiction and venue therein.  If any provision of this Agreement is for any reason found to be unenforceable, the remainder of this Agreement will continue in full force and effect.  If any action is necessary to enforce the terms of this Agreement, the substantially prevailing party will be entitled to reasonable attorneys’ fees, costs and expenses in addition to any other relief to which such prevailing party may be entitled. The parties agree that legal remedies may be inadequate to enforce the provisions of this Agreement and that the Company may use equitable relief, including specific performance and injunctive relief, to enforce the provisions of this Agreement. IN NO EVENT SHALL THE COMPANY BE LIABLE FOR ANY SPECIAL, INCIDENTAL, INDIRECT OR CONSEQUENTIAL DAMAGES OF ANY KIND IN CONNECTION WITH THIS AGREEMENT, EVEN IF THE COMPANY HAS BEEN INFORMED IN ADVANCE OF THE POSSIBILITY OF SUCH DAMAGES.  IN NO EVENT SHALL THE COMPANY’S LIABILITY ARISING OUT OF OR IN CONNECTION WITH THIS AGREEMENT EXCEED THE AMOUNTS PAID BY THE COMPANY TO PROVIDER UNDER THIS AGREEMENT FOR THE SERVICES, DELIVERABLES OR INVENTION GIVING RISE TO SUCH LIABILITY.

.  All notices required or permitted under this Agreement will be in writing and delivered by confirmed facsimile transmission, by email with proof of receipt, by courier or overnight delivery service, or by certified mail, and in each instance will be deemed given upon receipt.  All notices will be sent to the addresses set forth below or to such other address as may be specified by either party to the other in accordance with this Section.

. This Agreement may be executed in any number of counterparts, each of which shall be an original, and all of which together shall constitute one and the same instrument. Electronic signatures shall have the same effect as an original.
IN WITNESS WHEREOF, the parties have executed this Agreement as of the date first written above.
This Project Description is incorporated into the Service Provider Agreement effective as of _______________, 2021 between [COMPANY NAME], and [PROVIDER NAME] (the “
”).  Capitalized terms not otherwise defined herein have the meanings ascribed to them in the Agreement.
In exchange for the compensation set forth below, Provider will provide services as follows: [INSERT DESCRIPTION OF SERVICES AS APPLICABLE].
If the user chose hourly/montly/weekly rate, use this in the contract
In consideration for the Services rendered by the Service Provider pursuant to this Agreement, the Company shall pay the Service Provider a hourly/monthly/weekly fee in the amount equal to $_______
If the user chose a fixed price, use this in the contract

In consideration for the Services rendered by the Service Provider pursuant to this Agreement, the Company shall pay the Service Provider a fixed price fee in the amount equal to $_______ . $_____ shall be paid as a down payment upon signing. Balance shall be paid upon completion of the Services.

The Services will be provided [Fixed amount of months/years] / [project compleation] / [open ended] commencing on the Start Date (stated below) and will continue until [Start Date+Fixed amount of months/years] [completion of the Services] or termination as provided in Section 4 of the Agreement.
”) is entered into by and between [COMPANY NAME], a Delaware corporation (the “
”) effective as of the first date on which the Provider provided or provides services for the Company.

In consideration of the promises and mutual covenants herein contained, and other good and valuable consideration, the receipt and sufficiency of which is hereby acknowledged, it is mutually covenanted and agreed by and between the parties as follows:

. Provider shall at all times during the term of Provider’s service to the Company and thereafter, hold in the strictest confidence, and not use, except for the benefit of the Company, or disclose to any person, firm or corporation without written authorization of the Chief Executive Officer of the Company any Confidential Information of the Company. As used herein, “

” means any Company proprietary information, technical data, trade secrets or know-how, including, but not limited to, research, product plans, products, services, investors, business partners, customer lists and customers (including, but not limited to, those of the Company on whom Provider has called or with whom Provider became acquainted during the term of Provider’s service to the Company), markets, technology, developments, inventions, processes, methods of operation, formulas, designs, drawings, engineering,  marketing, finances or other business information disclosed to Provider by the Company either directly or indirectly in writing, orally or by drawings or observation of parts or equipment. “Confidential Information” does not include any of the foregoing items that have become publicly known and made generally available through no wrongful act of Provider or of others who were under confidentiality obligations as to the item or items involved or improvements or new versions thereof.

. Provider shall not, during Provider’s service to the Company, improperly use or disclose any proprietary information or trade secrets of any former or concurrent employer or other person or entity and Provider shall not bring onto the premises of the Company any unpublished document or proprietary information belonging to any such employer, person or entity unless consented to in writing by such employer, person or entity.

. Provider shall hold in the strictest confidence all confidential or proprietary information that the Company has received from any third party and with respect to which it is the Company’s obligation to maintain confidence. Provider shall only use such information for certain limited purposes in the strictest confidence and shall not disclose such information to any person, firm or corporation, or use such information except as necessary in carrying out Provider’s work for the Company consistent with the Company’s agreement with such third party.
. Provider hereby represents, warrants and covenants as follows:

. Provider hereby represents that there are [no] inventions, original works of authorship, developments, improvements, and trade secrets which were made by Provider prior to Provider’s service to the Company (collectively referred to as “

”), which belong to Provider (and not to any prior employer), which relate to the Company’s business, proposed business, products or research and development, and which are not assigned to the Company hereunder [as described in Schedule A]. If in the course of Provider’s service to the Company, Provider incorporates into a product, process or machine for the benefit of the Company a Prior Invention owned by Provider or in which the Provider has an interest, the Company is hereby granted and shall have a nonexclusive, royalty-free, irrevocable, perpetual, worldwide license to make, have made, modify, use and sell such Prior Invention as part of or in connection with such product, process or machine.

. Provider shall make, or will promptly make, full written disclosure to the Company, will hold in trust for the sole right and benefit of the Company, and hereby assigns and agrees to assign to the Company, or its designee, all of Provider’s right, title, and interest in and to any and all inventions, original works of authorship, developments, concepts, improvements, videos, designs, discoveries, ideas, trademarks or trade secrets, whether or not patentable or registrable under copyright or similar laws, which Provider may solely or jointly conceive or develop or reduce to practice, or cause to be conceived or developed or reduced to practice, during the period of time Provider is providing services to the Company (collectively referred to as “

”). Provider hereby acknowledges that all original works of authorship that are made by Provider (solely or jointly with others) within the scope of and during the period of Provider’s service to the Company are (i) “works made for hire,” as that term is defined in the United States Copyright Act (to the extent protectable by copyright); and (ii) together with all related intellectual property rights of any sort anywhere in the world, the sole property of the Company. Provider hereby understands and agrees that the decision whether or not to commercialize or market any Inventions developed by Provider solely or jointly with others is within the Company’s sole discretion and for the Company’s sole benefit and that no royalty will be due to Provider as a result of the Company’s efforts to commercialize or market any such Inventions.

. Provider shall assist the Company, or its designee, at the Company’s expense, in every proper way to secure the Company’s rights in the Inventions and any copyrights, patents, mask work rights or other intellectual property rights relating thereto in any and all countries, including the disclosure to the Company of all pertinent information and data with respect thereto, the execution of all applications, specifications, oaths, assignments and all other instruments which the Company shall deem necessary in order to apply for and obtain such rights and in order to assign and convey to the Company, its successors, assigns, and nominees the sole and exclusive rights, title and interest in and to such Inventions, and any copyrights, patents, mask work rights or other intellectual property rights relating thereto. Provider agrees that it is Provider’s obligation to execute or cause to be executed, when it is in Provider’s power to do so, any such instrument or papers after the termination of this Agreement. If the Company is unable because of the Provider’s mental or physical incapacity or for any other reason to secure Provider’s signature to apply for or to pursue any application for any United States or foreign patents or copyright registrations covering Inventions or original works of authorship assigned to the Company as set forth above, then Provider hereby irrevocably designates and appoints the Company and its duly authorized officers and agents as Provider’s agent and attorney in fact, to act for and in Provider’s behalf and stead to execute and file any such applications and to do all other lawfully permitted acts to further the prosecution and issuance of letters patent or copyright registrations thereon with the same legal force and effect as if executed by Provider.

.  Provider acknowledges that because of the difficulty of establishing when any idea, process, invention, etc., is first conceived or developed by Provider, or whether it results from access to Confidential Information or the Company’s equipment, facilities and data, Provider agrees that any idea, process, trademark, service mark, invention, technology, computer program, original work of authorship, design, formula, discovery, patent, copyright, or any improvement, rights, or claims related to the foregoing shall be presumed to be an Invention if it is conceived, developed, used, sold, exploited, or reduced to practice by Provider or with Provider’s aid within one (1) year after Provider’s termination of engagement with the Company.  Provider can rebut the above presumption if Provider proves that the idea, process, invention, etc., is not an Invention as defined in Section 2(b).

. Upon any termination of service to the Company, Provider covenants that Provider shall deliver to the Company (and will not keep in Provider’s possession, recreate or deliver to anyone else) any and all devices, records, data, notes, reports, proposals, lists, correspondence, specifications, drawings, blueprints, sketches, materials, equipment, other documents or property, or reproductions of any aforementioned items developed by Provider pursuant to Provider’s service to the Company or otherwise belonging to the Company, its successors or assigns.
. Provider acknowledges that Provider has had the right to consult with counsel and is fully aware of Provider’s rights and obligations under this Agreement.
. This Agreement may not be assigned by Provider without the consent of the Company. This Agreement shall inure to the benefit of the Company’s successors and assigns.
. The invalidity or unenforceability of any provision of this Agreement, or any terms hereof, shall not affect the validity or enforceability of any other provision or term of this Agreement.

. This Agreement shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the internal substantive laws, but not the choice of law rules, of the State of New York. Any dispute arising hereunder shall be resolved in accordance with the dispute resolution procedures set forth in the Provider’s Consulting Agreement with the Company.

. Provider acknowledges that the restrictions contained in this Agreement are necessary for the protection of the business and goodwill of the Company and are considered by Provider to be reasonable for such purpose. Provider agrees that any breach of this Agreement is likely to cause the Company substantial and irrevocable damage which is difficult to measure. Therefore, in the event of any such breach or threatened breach, Provider agrees that the Company, in addition to such other remedies which may be available, shall have the right to specific performance of the provisions of this Agreement and shall have the right to obtain an injunction from a court restraining such a breach or threatened breach, and Provider hereby waives the adequacy of a remedy at law as a defense to such relief.

. This Agreement may be executed in any number of counterparts, each of which shall be an original, and all of which together shall constitute one and the same instrument. Electronic signatures shall have the same effect as an original.
IN WITNESS WHEREOF, the parties have executed this Agreement as of the day and year written below.
Schedule A to Confidentiality and Inventions Assignment Agreement
